title: core/types: Why do not use b.header.Hash() in block Hash()?
body:
Hello everyone, 

Why the `func (b *Block) Hash() common.Hash` is use [rlpHash(b.header)](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/types/block.go#L384) rather than
 [b.header.Hash()](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/types/block.go#L101) ?



I build a private chain and custom logic `func (h *Header) Hash() common.Hash`(filter some field then return).

Then i got problem when `geth console` is starting.
But `geth init` can work.

#### System information

Geth version: `1.6.5`
OS & Version: OSX

#### Log
*geth init*
```
➜  go-ethereum ✗ build/bin/geth --datadir "$chaindir" init "$chaindir/genesis.json"
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/Users/Edwin/Downloads/geth/chaindata cache=16 handles=16
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Writing custom genesis block 
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Successfully wrote genesis state         database=chaindata                                              hash=e9df6f…7a6efa
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/Users/Edwin/Downloads/amis_pbft_data/0/geth/lightchaindata cache=16 handles=16
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Writing custom genesis block 
INFO [06-06|17:19:16] Successfully wrote genesis state         database=lightchaindata                                              hash=e9df6f…7a6efa
```

*geth console*
```
➜  go-ethereum ✗ build/bin/geth --identity "mchain_dev_local_1" --rpc --rpcport "$rpcport" --rpccorsdomain "*" --datadir "$chaindir" --port "$port" --nodiscover --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3" --networkid "20160816" --nat "any" --debug console
INFO [06-06|17:19:18|node/node.go:169] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/mchain_dev_local_1/v1.6.5-stable-14e5459b/darwin-amd64/go1.7.3
INFO [06-06|17:19:18|ethdb/database.go:69] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/Users/Edwin/Downloads/amis_pbft_data/0/geth/chaindata cache=128 handles=1024
WARN [06-06|17:19:18|eth/db_upgrade.go:52] Upgrading chain database to use sequential keys 
INFO [06-06|17:19:18|eth/backend.go:114]   Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 2016 Homestead: <nil> DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: false EIP150: <nil> EIP155: <nil> EIP158: <nil> Metropolis: <nil> Engine: customized}"
INFO [06-06|17:19:18|eth/db_upgrade.go:75] Database conversion successful 
INFO [06-06|17:19:18|eth/backend.go:137]   Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=20160816
Fatal: Error starting protocol stack: Genesis not found in chain
```

We can change it to use the `Hash` method, but I would not recommend making a private chain that excludes certain items from the block hash. Block hashes should identify the block completely and not allow multiple encodings of the same block. There is a lot of other code assuming that blocks with equal hashes are really the same block.
